Articles.Content:
How tall are they, exactly? My own calculations yielded 39-ish cm on average.

This version has them at 41cm but the helmets top them out at 43-44cm.

These are fantastic, I hope there are more to come! How about comparing Kerbol to Canis Majoris? If you can create a large enough image...

Thanks Squeal. Not sure what I\'m going to do next. I thought of moving on from comparisons to other types of diagrams. We shall see!
Kerbal Space Center facilities
HarvesteR, hire this man as your chief concept artist/content designer!

Kerbal Space Center facilities

I guess Recovery is for refuelling of solid boosters, isn\'t it? Or is it the clone fab? ;P

Scale of Human and Kerbal crew and spacecraft

Niiiice.

A Mercury should be something like 50cm diameter then, and a Gemini 70 cm... (reentry module)

(Though I\'d favor a small retcon in the future, when we get more stock parts: 1m Gemini, 70cm Mercury, 1,5m Apollo... but we\'ll see. No real problems with just making 50cm the starting 'node', it\'s just a number after all and Kerbin IS tiny.)

The space center concept is also very nice: it seems a bit too organized even; not just for Kerbals, Cape Kennedy isn\'t that geometric also...

Kerbal Space Center facilities

Looks very cool. I realy like the layout. Almost if it was a screenshot of the future version of the game.

Thanks guys for the kind words.

@Shedao Yes, I imagine it\'s for recovery/recycling of anything that parachutes safely away during launch...or falls off before takeoff.

@thorfinn I guess there\'s no harm in a 50cm command pod. I think the parachute part is about that diameter to begin with. For the space center geometry, that\'s just playing with the crop-circle motif similar to what Planet 51 did. I have a version that\'s hexagonal and one that\'s more random, but I liked how this one fit with KSP\'s current launch pad. Plus it would look cool from orbit.

HarvesteR, hire this man as your chief concept artist/content designer!

You know when Silisko of all people says that, then you\'re real good at this.
Messing around with city lights

;D

Yeah, you just got promoted to chief concept artist.....

Seriously good work here.

-'Kerbin Lights' snipped-

Messing around with city lights

It\'s nice, but doesn\'t look quite right. To be honest, first thing I thought was it looked a little like the spray effect from MSPaint. If you compare it with images of earth at night, it has something missing.

It\'s nice, but doesn\'t look quite right. To be honest, first thing I thought was it looked a little like the spray effect from MSPaint. If you compare it with images of earth at night, it has something missing.

I agree. it\'s still missing the continuous stream of light that outlines the coast, and strings of lights connecting huge population centers. Still working on that version.

Kerbal Space Center facilities

Cool pic, and I like the concept; just one bit of opinion: I personally would have put the Recovery building by the water, because water landings are likely to be more common as a general rule.

Sure, why not. A road could be extended out from the pad to the water. The idea is that each area attached to a road is a construction spot, so anyone could click and build a structure wherever they wanted.
the R&D building should have a junk yard behind it.
So YOU\'RE the one!
Updated image. Could be better. Ah well, moving on.

So YOU\'RE the one!

A little over 6 days worth of superiority 8)

-snip-

Updated image. Could be better. Ah well, moving on.

Oooooooh. Kerbin with clouds. They sort of look like Venus\' clouds.

-snip-

Updated image. Could be better. Ah well, moving on.

Looks much better. Maybe throw in a couple of bits where the coastal lights aren\'t continuous and some dense urban centres.

I\'m working on a flight director kerbin. His name is Gene after Gene Kranz who I\'m basing him off of.

It might be a little early to post it in this thread but I wanted some feedback so far.

Also is there an established number of fingers that a kerbin has? I was thinking of going with just 4.

As long as their hands aren\'t actually shaped like mittens, it will be good.

Also is there an established number of fingers that a kerbin has? I was thinking of going with just 4.

We decided on 4 fingers for our comics, so that would fit well.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky
